action: I want to accurately register and update product inventory counts
reason: To prevent inventory discrepancies and shipping errors, and to maintain optimal stock levels
acceptance_criteria: Inventory operations are only executable by authenticated users.
Roles capable of updating inventory are restricted to Logistics / Admin.
product_id must exist in the product master data.
Processing fails if a non-existent product_id is specified.
Warehouse ID (warehouse_id) is mandatory.
IDs not present in the warehouse master cannot be registered.
Inventory quantities are managed as integer types.
Registration of negative inventory values is prohibited (excluding adjustment processes).
The transaction category (IN / OUT / ADJUST) is mandatory.
Invalid category values are rejected.
The process fails if there is insufficient stock during an OUT transaction.
Inventory locking is performed during simultaneous updates.
Concurrency control is implemented via optimistic or row-level locking.
Pre-update and post-update inventory counts are saved in the history.
Inventory updates are completed within a single transaction.
Rollback is performed if the process fails midway.
The same validation applies to updates via API.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Successful update logs are stored.
Failed update logs are stored.
Logs include the operating user ID.
Operation timestamps are automatically recorded.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
A full history of all inventory changes is maintained.
Supports bulk inventory updates via CSV.
The same validation applies during CSV updates.
CSV error rows are skipped and logged.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
HTTPS communication is mandatory.
Target API response time is within 400ms.
The API is REST-compliant.
Data is unified in UTF-8.
An alert event is issued when inventory falls below a threshold.
Alerts are processed via an asynchronous queue.
Inventory integration with external shipping systems is possible.
A Webhook notification function exists.
Unauthorized access attempts return a 403 Forbidden error.
Authorization checks are executed on the backend side.
Update results are immediately reflected on the UI.
The inventory update API considers idempotency.
Retry control for timeouts is implemented.
Inventory data is included in the backup targets.
Disaster recovery procedures are defined.
An inventory consistency check is executed by a nightly batch process.
Consistency errors are notified to the administrator.
